A reward casket (beginner) is received after completing the final clue of a beginner clue scroll trail, and contains the final reward for the trail.

While players can only have one of each type of clue scroll in their possession, they can possess unlimited amounts of reward caskets, and are eligible to receive clue scrolls again once it is obtained.

The beginner reward casket, unlike other reward caskets, cannot be opened on Entrana. If players attempt to do so, the chatbox will state "You cannot open this on Entrana, the monks are watching you too closely." Furthermore, accounts that are less than 10 hours old will not be able to receive any unique rewards from these caskets.[1]

Rewards[edit | edit source]

Beginner clues generate a minimum of 1 reward and a maximum of 3, granting an average of 2 rewards per casket. The rewards consist of generic items, and items that are unique for beginner clues.

All droprates are confirmed by Mod Tide.[2] The listed rarities are per roll.

The average loot roll is worth 4,033. On average, beginner clues are worth 8,066.

Beginner clue uniques[edit | edit source]

  • The chance to receive any unique is 1/24 per roll, with a specific unique being 1/360 per roll. Players obtain an average of 1 unique per 12 clue scrolls, and a specific unique an average of once per 180 clue scrolls.

Food[edit | edit source]

When you hit the 1 in 12 chance for a unique, you will then hit a sub table where you have a 50% chance to receive either some cabbages or a unique drop.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
29 January 2020
(update | poll)

Players can now unlock the Explore emote for completing 600 beginner clue scrolls.

15 August 2019
(update | poll)

The locks on the reward casket have been changed to reflect the tier of Treasure Trail it comes from.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When a player rolls the unique drop table, there is a 50% chance that the player will receive a cabbage or a unique item.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 24 July 2021. (Archived from the original on 22:34, 29 July 2021 (UTC).) Mod Ash: "10 hours, applies to all accounts doing beginner clues."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Tide's Twitter account. 11 October 2019. (Archived from the original on 11 October 2019.) Mod Tide: "Hey guys and gals, i'ts been 6 months since the release of beginner clues so I thought you might like to see what the drop rates are! Enjoy those cabbages, they taste great."
